newsitem.title: BULGARIA: No corporate stocks trade in Bulgaria this week.
newsitem.headline: No corporate stocks trade in Bulgaria this week.

text.p: No corporate issues traded for a third week in a row on the Bulgarian stock market where no shares were bid or offered due to low interest, brokers said.
"There were no shares on offer and neither brokers nor investors bid for shares because of low yields and high risk compared to other investments," said a broker from the Sofia Stock Exchange (SSE).
Investors eyed treasury paper or foreign currency investments instead, the broker said.
Short-term government paper now yields between 108 and 188 percent while the lev kept falling on the domestic forex market, trading near 199.50 on Friday, down from 194.20/30 a week ago.
Only the SSE operated this week after the Bulgarian Stock Exchange (BSE) went into a summer recess on August 5.
The BSE will resume trading on September 2.
Only three repo deals in treasury paper were struck on the SSE where weekly repo turnover rose to 3.264 million levs from 2.0 million levs last week.
The 13-share Reuter All Bulgaria Stock Exchange Index (RABSI) closed at 41.31 points, unchanged from last Friday.
* RABSI calculated on daily basis since February 1, 1994
